greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of chiral pairs of color loops of length n with exactly k different colors.
comment: In other words, the number of n-bead bracelets with beads of exactly k different colors that when turned over are different from themselves. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 13 2019
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275 (first 50 rows)
formula: T(n,k) = -(k!/4)*(S2(floor((n+1)/2),k) + S2(ceiling((n+1)/2),k)) + (k!/(2 n))*Sum_{d|n} phi(d)*S2(n/d,k), where S2(n,k) is the Stirling subset number A008277.
T(n, k) = Sum_{i=0..k} (-1)^(k-i)*binomial(k,i)*A293496(n, i). - _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 13 2019
example: For T(4,3)=3, the chiral pairs are AABC-AACB, ABBC-ACBB, and ABCC-ACCB.
For T(4,4)=3, the chiral pairs are ABCD-ADCB, ABDC-ACDB, and ACBD-ADBC.
mathematica: Table[(k!/(2n)) DivisorSum[n, EulerPhi[#] StirlingS2[n/#, k] &] - (k!/4) (StirlingS2[Floor[(n+1)/2], k] + StirlingS2[Ceiling[(n+1)/2], k]), {n, 1, 15}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten
program: (PARI) T(n,k) = {-k!*(stirling((n+1)\2,k,2) + stirling(n\2+1,k,2))/4 + k!*sumdiv(n,d, eulerphi(d)*stirling(n/d,k,2))/(2*n)} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 13 2019
results.author: _Robert A. Russell_, Jun 04 2018
